availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Baxter W. Haile (Caldwell County, Ky, farmer )

body.p: Bedford County, Tennessee and Caldwell County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer. Tennessee native. Son of James Haile and Susan Ragsdale Haile. Married to Rebecca Haile. Father of William Haile, James Haile, John Haile, Elizabeth Haile, Virginia Haile, S. A. Haile, and Henry Haile. Laborer in Bedford County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Bedford County, District 4, p. 111B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 155.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Tennessee, p. 524A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #9308.
